cab.content: (THIS DOCIMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITAfrTCC/l&JESTY'S GOVEKM&BNT')S* C R S copy NO.W.P.(40) 356- l/rot jimdpr LOCK AN:4th September, 1940* iO BL: I _______-.' .': - : t.p-,..,:.- ,h thai special care may be taken :Xensure the secrecy of this dooumeiT,7 A R "CABINET.THE MUNITIONS SITUATION.Memorandum by the Secretary of State for War.I have read with much interest the memorandum by the Ministerof Supply, W.P.(40) 339* on the munitions situation.I now propose to submit to my colleagues a memorandum, outlining the Army programme as it can now be envisaged up to the spring of 1942.In this memorandum I intend to review the man-power aspect in its relation to the production of equipment and will seek to relate themboth to possible operational plans.A.E.The^ar Office,4th September, 1940.G" 3255).
